body.name: AMD Ryzen 7 5700G 8-Core, 16-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor & ASUS Prime B550-PLUS AMD AM4 Zen 3 Ryzen 5000 & 3rd Gen Ryzen ATX Motherboard
features: Play some of the most popular games at 1080p with the fastest processor graphics in the world, no graphics card required
8 Cores and 16 processing threads, bundled with the AMD Wraith Stealth cooler
4.6 GHz Max Boost, unlocked for overclocking, 20 MB cache, DDR4-3200 support
AMD AM4 Socket and PCIe 4. 0: The perfect pairing for Zen 3 Ryzen 5000 & 3rd Gen AMD Ryzen CPUs

Ultrafast Connectivity: 1x PCIe4. 0 x16 SafeSlot, 1Gb LAN, dual M. 2 slots (NVMe SSD)—one with PCIe 4. 0 x4 connectivity, USB 3. 2 Gen 2 Type-A , HDMI 2. 1, 4K@60HZ, DisPlay port 1. 2 and Thunderbolt 3 header
Comprehensive Cooling: VRM heatsink, chipset heatsink, hybrid fan headers and Fan Xpert 2 utility

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.8 4.8 out of 5 stars 6,577 ratings 4.8 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High-performance processor that offers impressive specifications
reviews.reviewText: The AMD Ryzen 7 5700G is a high-performance processor that offers impressive specifications and capabilities. In this extensive review, we will delve into the processor's architecture, performance, integrated graphics, power efficiency, and overall value for users seeking a powerful CPU for their computing needs.Architecture:The AMD Ryzen 7 5700G is based on the Zen 3 architecture, featuring a 7nm manufacturing process and a chiplet design that enables efficient performance and power management. The processor incorporates an 8-core, 16-thread configuration, with a base clock speed of 3.8 GHz and a boost clock speed of up to 4.6 GHz, delivering exceptional multi-threaded and single-threaded performance.Performance:With its multi-core prowess and high clock speeds, the Ryzen 7 5700G excels in demanding workloads, such as content creation, video editing, 3D rendering, and software development. The processor's Zen 3 architecture enhances instructions per clock (IPC) performance, resulting in snappy and efficient operation across a wide range of applications.Integrated Graphics:One of the standout features of the Ryzen 7 5700G is its integrated Radeon graphics based on the Vega architecture. The processor includes 8 compute units (CUs) running at up to 2.0 GHz, providing capable integrated graphics performance for casual gaming, multimedia tasks, and light content creation without the need for a dedicated graphics card.Power Efficiency:The Ryzen 7 5700G showcases remarkable power efficiency, thanks to its 7nm process and refined architecture. The processor's power management allows for efficient utilization of resources, contributing to lower power consumption and heat output, making it an excellent choice for small form factor builds and energy-conscious users.Overall Value:From a value perspective, the AMD Ryzen 7 5700G offers a compelling proposition for users who prioritize both strong CPU and integrated GPU performance. Its versatility makes it an ideal choice for budget-friendly gaming rigs, home theater PCs, and productivity-focused systems where space and power constraints are factors to consider.In conclusion, the AMD Ryzen 7 5700G impresses with its Zen 3 architecture, robust multi-threaded performance, capable integrated Radeon graphics, power efficiency, and overall value for users looking for a well-rounded processor with integrated graphics capabilities.If you have any further questions or need additional details about the AMD Ryzen 7 5700G, feel free to ask!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Mainly use it for normal offimatics and popular gamesThe integrated graphics are very nice, it allows me to play many popular games in low or medium settings and/or with use of FSR. Less demanding games allow for high settings. Overall the performance is good, worth the buck even though a 170 price may seem high for budget builds buy this will allow you to continue longer without having to replace your cpu, as this can take a for example 7800xt no problem

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 8 Cores Low Price
reviews.reviewText: Great CPU, you get 8 Cores, 16 Threads Zen 3 architecture. Only downside (why I took off 1 star for gaming) is PCIe Gen 3 only. Now this will not matter if you are using a low to mod range card (as of this writing) ie RX 7600, RTX 4060 / 4060 Ti or under as they will not use all the bandwidth on Gen 3 lanes. If you are going a higher GPU than those spend the little more for the 5700X (it won't include it wouldn't include a heatsink / fan so you would one as well).Some of the big draws to this CPU* Built off mobile chip so runs cool* Included Heatsink / Fan will cool it at stock fine* Pretty decent iGPU (if you don't game or do very light gaming, Stardew Valley, MineCraft, etc. you wont need a graphics card)* Can be overclockedGreat CPU for budget builds.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Ryzen 7 , love this. Price was great and shipping was fast.
reviews.reviewText: Had to upgrade bios but asus makes it easy. Love how much faster this ryzen 7 is to a ryzen 3. Worked right out of the box.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars By far exeded my expetations
reviews.reviewText: This is a fantastic APU...I was coming from an 2400G that core was aperently ment for middle of the road performance with a side of it can do light gaming/rendering this one is a high end 8core/16thread with a side of it can also game/render lol...in all honesty I really didn't need anything this crazy I was just looking to put tother another ultra small form factor system and I wanted to try out the new inwin b1 case with it's improved(over the inwin chopin non pro{full disclosure I didn't know the chopin pro with the 200watt PSU existed cuz I probably wound have purchesed that instead of the b1 becase the brushed aluminum absolutely premium build and way better cooling with the all mesh side panel...ok I think I just talked myself into getting one of those aswell lol I'll turn the b1 into a server or something lol})power supply and odd not quite retro but not quite space age theme and this core ended up being listed around Thanksgiving for the MSRP of the 6core varient so that's why I got this and now my big rig with the 3700x is kinda put to shame lol...it is paired with a founders rtx 2070super tho so in that regard this Apu is not showing off but I have it paired with 32gb of ddr4 at 4000mhz cl18(cl16 easly achievable if I drop down to 3933 which I have done cuz Iv notice real performance difrences between cl16 and cl18 more so than any deminished performance from dropping 66mhz) and a 1tb nvme pcie4.0 SSD and 2 fairly fast 2tb SSHDs in the back of the b1 and also a secound m.2 measly 500gb nvme on a risser in the unused pcie16x slot and all together this system has unintentionally replaiced my main rig as my daily driver ..it's just so fast and if I'm not trying to game at 4k I don't even consider turning on the other system, considering I spend most of my time on Linux doing CPU intensive tasks and consuming multimedia not gaming this core is completely meeting all of my needs and arguably significantly exceeding them ...all the being sead I would not have payed for this core at much higher of a price, I know iv seen it upwards of $400...ya no that a non apu 12core/24thread price point but if you can catch this one on a sale for $300 or less it is an absolute beast with the added bonus of the best integrated graphics the modern world has seen to date🤪...later edit...well and addendum realyOk so iv also purchased the 5600G and well, they feel the same, it is comparably fast vs the 8core at "normal" user tasks lol, I realy only see the 8 core stretch its legs when compiling large sets of source code and that's only if I deliberately tell it to use 16threads, ya honestly the 5600G might be the better of the 2 for its target userbase... BUT it needs to come in at a noticeable price difrence, unlike in my situation were they were both unbelievably cheap becase I caught them both will at a low point in the market...But ya I just wanted to add that little anecdote with my experience with both of these core, now being fair to the 8 core now I have the 6 core paired with only 16gb of ram in a asrock deskmini x300m, ya these to with there detremetanly difrent total price points don't feel difrent in any way with normal load, there both stupid fast giving you a respectable instruction per clock that I'll make "normal" people work and entertainment just butter smooth...what more needs to be sead realy lol...
De los mejores procesadores de la serie 5000 en mi opinión.
Muito boa velocidade, tem respondido bem para jogos

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good cpu if you don't have a graphic card
reviews.reviewText: It is a very good product just like any that amd does and the included gpu works very well with many games. I even play with Diablo with it and no problem at all. It is a good alternative for someone that does not have the money to get a separate gpu. I got 3 of them for my customers and they all like it. Good product good quality and Amazon have good price on this item. Get it you will not be sorry. The only thing missing is a fan with rgb. The one from amd is a plain fan but it does the job well.

Ich habe die CPU im Dezember 2023 zum Preis von 178,-EUR gekauft und in einem Asrock DeskMini X300 verbaut. Zur Seite stehen 2 x 16GB Crucial RAM CT2K16G4SFRA32A. Als Kühler ist ein Noctua NH-L9a-AM4 installiert. Das System arbeitet leise, sehr performant und kommt ohne dedizierte Grafikkarte aus. Mit nur 65 Watt TDP ist die CPU auch sehr sparsam.Man sollte wissen, dass der Ryzen 7 5700G kein PCIe 4 unterstützt, sondern "nur" PCIe 3. Ein wirkliches Manko ist das zumindest in meinem Anwendungsfall jedoch nicht. Ich bin von dem nur 2L großen Kraftzwerg einfach nur begeistert und empfehle den Prozessor uneingeschränkt.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ryzen 7 5700G: una centrale elettrica nelle prestazioni
reviews.reviewText: Il processore Ryzen 7 5700G di AMD ha fatto ondate nel mondo dell'informatica, offrendo una combinazione avvincente di potenza, efficienza e prestazioni grafiche integrate. Come parte della serie Ryzen 5000, il 5700G ha alzato l'asticella di ciò che gli appassionati possono aspettarsi da un processore desktop. In questa recensione, esploreremo le caratteristiche chiave e gli aspetti delle prestazioni che fanno risaltare il Ryzen 7 5700G.Prestazioni:Il Ryzen 7 5700G, costruito sull'architettura Zen 3, offre prestazioni eccezionali in una vasta gamma di attività. La sua configurazione 8-core e 16 thread garantisce un multitasking e una reattività fluidi, rendendolo una scelta ideale sia per i creatori di contenuti che per i giocatori. L'orologio di base di 3,8 GHz, con un boost clock fino a 4,6 GHz, mostra la sua abilità nella gestione di applicazioni impegnative.Grafica integrata (Vega):Una delle caratteristiche di spicco del Ryzen 7 5700G è la sua soluzione grafica integrata, la GPU Radeon Vega. Con 8 unità di calcolo e una velocità di clock di 2,0 GHz, la grafica integrata offre prestazioni sorprendentemente capaci. Sebbene non sia un sostituto per le GPU dedicate nei giochi di fascia alta, offre una solida esperienza per il gioco casuale e le attività multimediali senza la necessità di una scheda grafica discreta.Efficienza e raffreddamento:Il 5700G eccelle nell'efficienza energetica, grazie al processo di produzione a 7 nm. Questo non solo contribuisce a ridurre il consumo energetico, ma aiuta anche a mantenere temperature più basse sotto carichi di lavoro pesanti. Il dispositivo di raffreddamento Wraith Stealth incluso è una gradita aggiunta, fornendo prestazioni termiche decenti e assicurando che il processore rimanga fresco anche durante un uso prolungato.Compatibilità:Il Ryzen 7 5700G è compatibile con una vasta gamma di schede madri AM4 esistenti, rendendolo un'opzione interessante per gli utenti che desiderano aggiornare il proprio sistema senza cambiare l'intera piattaforma. La facilità di integrazione aggiunge al valore complessivo di questo processore.Potenziale di overclocking:Per gli appassionati che cercano prestazioni aggiuntive, il Ryzen 7 5700G offre il supporto moltiplicatore sbloccato per l'overclocking. Con soluzioni di raffreddamento adeguate, gli utenti possono spingere il processore oltre le sue frequenze di serie, estraendo ancora più potenza da questa già formidabile CPU.Conclusione:Il Ryzen 7 5700G è un'aggiunta stellare alla linea di AMD, trovando un eccellente equilibrio tra prestazioni, capacità grafiche integrate ed efficienza energetica. Che tu sia un creatore di contenuti, un giocatore o qualcuno che apprezza una potente soluzione all-in-one, il Ryzen 7 5700G offre su più fronti. Mentre la mancanza di supporto PCIe 4.0 può deludere alcuni, la versatilità e il valore complessivi lo rendono una scelta convincente per gli utenti che desiderano costruire un sistema ad alte prestazioni senza spendere troppo. AMD continua a impressionare con il Ryzen 7 5700G, cementando la sua posizione di attore chiave nel mercato della CPU.
